metadata.title: CVE-2022-39393 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: Wasmtime is a standalone runtime for WebAssembly. Prior to version 2.0.2,there is a bug in Wasmtime's implementation of its pooling instanceallocator where when a linear memory is reused for another instance theinitial heap snapshot of the prior instance can be visible, erroneously tothe next instance. This bug has been patched and users should upgrade toWasmtime 2.0.2. Other mitigations include disabling the pooling allocatorand disabling the `memory-init-cow`.

criterions.comment: thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
mozjs78: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
mozjs91: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
